info.title: IA-Connect Microsoft Office
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for Microsoft Office automation.

post.summary: Create MS Word instance
post.description: Starts Microsoft Word using a Visual Basic Object to allow Word to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. Microsoft Word starts hidden because it doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

Handle.title: Word handle
Handle.description: A handle for this instance of Word to be used by other Word actions to distinguish between different instance of Word if more than one instance is running.

post.summary: Close MS Word instance
post.description: Closes an instance of Microsoft Word that was started using a Visual Basic Object (or attached to later). The instance of Word to close is defined by the handle.

Handle.title: Word handle
Handle.description: The handle of the instance of Word (as provided by 'Create instance' or 'Attach to existing instance') or 0 for the currently active instance of Word.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.summary: Detach from MS Word instance
post.description: Detaches from a running instance of Microsoft Word that was started using a Visual Basic Object (or attached to later). The instance of Word to detach from is defined by the handle.

Handle.title: Word handle
Handle.description: The handle of the instance of Word (as provided by 'Create instance' or 'Attach to existing instance') or 0 for the currently active instance of Word.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.summary: Attach to existing MS Word instance
post.description: Attaches to an instance Microsoft Word that has already been started.

Filename.title: File name
Filename.description: The filename of an open document in Word to attach to. If it is an empty document then enter the name of the document (e.g. 'Document1').

ToggleWindow.title: Toggle window
ToggleWindow.description: Should the Word window be toggled before attempting to attach? This helps to ensure that recently opened Word windows are visible to the Windows operating system.

ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.title: Toggle uses global left mouse click agent
ToggleUsesGlobalLeftMouseClickAgent.description: If choosing to toggle the Word window, this specifies whether to use global mouse clicks to focus the IA-Connect Agent first.

ToggleDelay.title: Toggle delay in seconds
ToggleDelay.description: If choosing to toggle the Word window, this specifies the pause after toggling.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

Handle.title: Word handle
Handle.description: A handle for this instance of Word to be used by other Word actions to distinguish between different instance of Word if more than one instance is running.

post.summary: Show MS Word
post.description: Makes an instance of Microsoft Word visible (referenced by the handle). This would typically only be used during development because Word doesn't need to be visible for automation.

EmailRead.description: Returns true if the email has been read or false if not

SentOnAsString.title: Email sent on
SentOnAsString.description: The DateTime when the email was sent

NumberOfAttachments.title: Number of attachments
NumberOfAttachments.description: The number of attachments included in the email

post.summary: Get number of MS Outlook mails
post.description: Returns the number of emails from a specified folder in Outlook that match the provided search criteria.

FolderPath.title: Folder path
FolderPath.description: The path to the specified folder to get emails from, e.g. Inbox

SearchSubject.title: Search subject
SearchSubject.description: A search subject or keyword to match emails on, for example 'Invoice'

SearchFromSMTP.title: Search from SMTP
SearchFromSMTP.description: A sender email address to match emails from

SearchFromName.title: Search from name
SearchFromName.description: A sender name to match emails from

SearchQuery.title: Search query
SearchQuery.description: A search query to match emails on. Example 1: [Importance] = 2Example 2: [Categories] = 'Personal'See the documentation for more examples.

SearchMaxAgeInDays.title: Search max age in days
SearchMaxAgeInDays.description: A maximum age of emails to return, in days

SearchStartDateTimeAsString.title: Search start date time
SearchStartDateTimeAsString.description: A start search datetime string, e.g. '2020-01-21T00:00:00' which would return all emails received after midnight on the 21st of January 2020. Please note, all datetimes are in UTC so you may wish to use the Convert DateTime action to convert your local time to UTC. If you do not provide a value, this will default to '1901-01-01T00:00:00'

SearchEndDateTimeAsString.title: Search end date time
SearchEndDateTimeAsString.description: An end search datetime string, e.g. '2020-01-28T00:00:00' which would return all emails received before midnight on the 28th of January 2020. Please note, all datetimes are in UTC so you may wish to use the Convert DateTime action to convert your local time to UTC. If you do not provide a value, this will default to '2999-01-01T00:00:00'

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

NumberOfEmailsMatchFilter.title: Number of emails match filter
NumberOfEmailsMatchFilter.description: The number of emails in the specified folder that match the provided search criteria
